definition: Good has its reward and evil has its recompense. The payback is just a matter of time
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4 , ruo4 ran2 bu4 bao4 shi2 chen2 wei4 dao4
containing_words.word: 善有善报，恶有恶报，若然不报时晨未到

sentences.english: I read newspaper, is wearing a Presbyopia mirror.
sentences.chinese: 我看书报时，是戴了老花眼镜。

sentences.english: I didn't hear the clock strike.
Still, I'm glad the bell is working again.
sentences.chinese: 不过，钟又能报时了，我很高兴。

sentences.english: The strikes of the clock woke me up.
sentences.chinese: 时钟报时的声音使我醒来。

sentences.english: We waited for the clock to strike.
Clock tell the time and trains take you places.
sentences.chinese: 钟要报时，火车要带你去往目的地。

sentences.english: The clock is timed to the moment.
We can tell the time by a clock.
This alarm mechanism fit for kinds of ordinary mechanical pendulum clock movements.
sentences.chinese: 这种报时装置适合于各种普通机械摆钟机心。

sentences.english: Clocks tell the time and trains take you places.
sentences.chinese: 钟要报时，火车要带你去往目的地。

sentences.english: The clock raised its voice now and then, but her husband did not return.
sentences.chinese: 时钟一次又一次鸣奏着报时，但她丈夫仍未回来。

sentences.english: This is the whole point of a small-time program, it is the value of learning.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个整点报时的小程序，很有学习价值的。

sentences.english: One night, however, our vicar woke up with a start: the clock was striking the hours! .
sentences.chinese: 但是有一晚牧师却被惊醒了，因为钟又在报时了。

sentences.english: The little clock tinkled out the hours.
sentences.chinese: 那只小钟丁当丁当地报时。

sentences.english: You can use your own images, melodies and chimes .
sentences.chinese: 你可以使用你自己的图像，音乐和报时音。

definition: to measure time/to time/to reckon by time
to sound the night watches (on clappers or gongs, in former times)
